content: Insurance Investments Savings Asked by AnonymousAsked on 21 Aug 2019What makes a good insurance agent?What is a good example of a good agent? How to choose a good agent who is knowledgeable and provides good customer service? My current Pru agent is unresponsive. I didn't expect much from her, answering my questions is the bare minimum she can do, yet she fails to do that. Currently finding a good agent to manage my Prudential policies and might be keen to do a portfolio review on my current policies too with Pru or other companies.Any recommendations?10 answersAnswerBump3
Answers (10)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Loh Tat TianLevel 6. MasterUpdated on 22 Aug 2019Are you looking into getting serviced and with an independent or Tied Agent (Prudential)?There are many advisors out there with different values and beliefs.(1) The most important criteria is that they should have a fiduciary duty to you. All Tied Agents do not have a fiduciary duty to you.(2) Their knowledge should be there. Preferably someone with ChFC or CFP etc. But certification doesn't mean anything, because they may still not hold their ethics high enough.(3) They should educate you on what common pitfalls to look out for. Like waiting periods, investment risk, your investment mindset or protection needs. They should be transparent with you on the fees and charges from the start, and especially if you ask them.You are the driver of your ship, always remember that. Advisors only advise the pros and cons, and what fits your plan. Hence, I agree that MoneyOwl can be a platform for you or other independent advisors who you can click with.Tied Agents have some disadvantages, but it's up to your preference.2 comments3

Question Poster22 Aug 2019If we bought policies from moneyowl/comparefirst what happen if we need to claim? Contact insurer directly?Loh Tat Tian22 Aug 2019If you bought from Direct Insurance, you will need to contact the customer service, fill up the relevant claim forms required yourself, and submit them.

If you bought from MoneyOwl, they have advisors that is working 9am to 5pm, which you can contact to process yor claims. You may want to contact MoneyOwl further to understand the claim process from them.

NNinjaLevel 3. WonderkidAnswered on 30 Aug 2019You could test them. Ask them about investment. Then preview their insurance coverage and be interested in investment link plans. If their face lights up, bingo! You found yourself a novice agent.0 comments0

Alan KorLevel 5. GeniusUpdated on 30 Aug 2019There is no answer for you.Agents are not legally obligated to service you. Their role is just to sell insurance products.Whether they answer your questions or provide customer service is totally up to them, beyond your control.Best to take charge of your insurance plans and learn how to DIY your claims.9 comments0
See all 9 comments Loh Tat Tian26 Aug 2019Cheers. I made my point.NNinja30 Aug 2019Agents literally need to wait for the underwriters to and they have no power. Retired agent here

Vincent Tan Wen Bin, Assistant Vice President at Thinkers AllianceLevel 5. GeniusAnswered on 03 Sep 2019There are many factors you might be looking at in a good agentresponsiveknowledgeableservice-oriented/customer-orientedethnical and honestygood camaraderie with the agentIt also does not stop you from having a few agents working for you as each might have their own speciality. Some might be good at insurance, some might be good in the investment area.0 comments0

Darren LimLevel 1. FreshieAnswered on 23 Aug 2019Hi there, I’m Darren Lim, a senior consultant with Prudential.
Firstly, I apologised for the unpleasant experience you’ve had with Pru. Being knowledgeable and having good customer service is definitely important. Not to mention, accountability. By the way, you mentioned that you’ve some questions that you‘ve yet to receive an answer to. Let me see if I’m able to help you with that.0 comments0

Luke Ho, Kick-Ass Financial Services Consultant at Trillion Financial PlannersLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 23 Aug 2019You choose someone who solves the conflicts of interests by addressing them when you ask1) How much do you make from this product2) Are there any other options3) Why you, over someone else4) Expectations for future service and reasons for themE.g. "I will review with you once a year because it's in my interest to do so since your needs change and I want to create customer loyalty."
I actually say this.
https://www.facebook.com/luke.ho.540 comments0
